org.typemeta.funcj.parser

Interface Parser<I,A>

  • Type Parameters:
    I - the input stream symbol type
    A - the parser result type
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Ref

    public interface Parser<I,A>
    A parser is essentially a function from an input stream to a parse Result. The Parser type along with the pure and ap functions constitute an applicative functor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Lazy<Boolean> acceptsEmpty()
      Indicate whether this parser accepts the empty symbol.
      default <B> ApplyBuilder._2<I,A,B> and(Parser<I,B> pb)
      Combine this parser with another to form a builder which accumulates the parse results.
      default <B> Parser<I,A> andL(Parser<I,B> pb)
      Combine this parser with another to form a parser which applies two parsers, and if they are both successful throws away the result of the right-hand parser, and returns the result of the left-hand parser
      default <B> Parser<I,B> andR(Parser<I,B> pb)
      Combine this parser with another to form a parser which applies two parsers, and if they are both successful throws away the result of the left-hand parser and returns the result of the right-hand parser
      static <I,A,B> Parser<I,B> ap(Functions.F<A,B> f, Parser<I,A> pa)
      Construct a parser that, if pa succeeds, yielding a function a, then it returns the result of applying function f to value a.
      static <I,A,B> Parser<I,B> ap(Parser<I,Functions.F<A,B>> pf, Parser<I,A> pa)
      Construct a parser that, if pf succeeds, yielding a function f, and if pa succeeds, yielding a value a, then it returns the result of applying function f to value a.
      default <OPEN,CLOSE>
      Parser<I,A>      		 between(Parser<I,OPEN> open, Parser<I,CLOSE> close)

      default Parser<I,A> chainl(Parser<I,Functions.Op2<A>> op, A a)
      A parser for an operand, followed by zero or more operands that are separated by operators.
      default Parser<I,A> chainl1(Parser<I,Functions.Op2<A>> op)
      A parser for an operand, followed by one or more operands that are separated by operators.
      default Parser<I,A> chainr(Parser<I,Functions.Op2<A>> op, A a)
      A parser for an operand, followed by zero or more operands that are separated by operators.
      default Parser<I,A> chainr1(Parser<I,Functions.Op2<A>> op)
      A parser for an operand, followed by one or more operands that are separated by operators.
      static <I,A> Parser<I,A> choice(IList.NonEmpty<Parser<I,A>> ps)
      A parser that attempts one or more parsers in turn and returns the result of the first that succeeds, or else fails.
      Lazy<SymSet<I>> firstSet()
      The First Set for this parser.
      default Parser<I,IList<A>> many()
      A parser which repeatedly applies this parser until it fails, and then returns an IList of the results.
      default Parser<I,IList.NonEmpty<A>> many1()
      A parser which applies this parser one or more times until it fails, and then returns an IList of the results.
      default <B> Parser<I,B> map(Functions.F<A,B> f)
      Construct a parser that, if this parser succeeds then returns the result of applying the function f to the result, otherwise return the failure.
      default Parser<I,Optional<A>> optional()
      A parser that applies this parser, and, if it succeeds, returns the result wrapped in an Optional, otherwise returns an empty Optional.
      default <B extends A>
      Parser<I,A>      		 or(Parser<I,B> rhs)
      Construct a parser which returns the result of either this parser or, if it fails, then the result of the rhs parser.

      • pure

        static <I,A> Parser<I,A> pure(A a)
        Applicative unit/pure function. Construct a parser that always returns the supplied value, without consuming any input.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the parser result type
        Parameters:
        a - the value
        Returns:
        a parser that always returns the supplied value

      • ap

        static <I,A,B> Parser<I,B> ap(Parser<I,Functions.F<A,B>> pf,
                              Parser<I,A> pa)
        Construct a parser that, if pf succeeds, yielding a function f, and if pa succeeds, yielding a value a, then it returns the result of applying function f to value a. Otherwise, if pf fails then the parser returns the failure, else if pa fails then it returns that failure.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the input type of the function
        B - the return type of the function
        Parameters:
        pf - the parser that returns a function result
        pa - the parser that returns a value result
        Returns:
        a parser that returns the result of applying the parsed function to the parsed value

      • ap

        static <I,A,B> Parser<I,B> ap(Functions.F<A,B> f,
                              Parser<I,A> pa)
        Construct a parser that, if pa succeeds, yielding a function a, then it returns the result of applying function f to value a. If pa fails then the parser returns the failure.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the input type of the function
        B - the return type of the function
        Parameters:
        f - the function
        pa - the parser that returns a value result
        Returns:
        a parser that returns the result of applying the function to the parsed value

      • traverse

        static <I,T,U> Parser<I,IList<U>> traverse(IList<T> lt,
                                           Functions.F<T,Parser<I,U>> f)
        Standard applicative traversal.

        Equivalent to 

        sequence(lt.map(f))
        .
        Type Parameters:
        I - the error type
        T - the type of list elements
        U - the type wrapped by the Try returned by the function
        Parameters:
        lt - the list of values
        f - the function to be applied to each value in the list
        Returns:
        a Parser which wraps an IList of values

      • sequence

        static <I,T> Parser<I,IList<T>> sequence(IList<Parser<I,T>> lpt)
        Standard applicative sequencing.

        Translate a IList of Parser into a Parser of an IList, by composing each consecutive Parser using the ap(Parser, Parser) method.

        Type Parameters:
        I - the error type
        T - the value type of the Parsers in the list
        Parameters:
        lpt - the list of Parser values
        Returns:
        a Parser which wraps an IList of values

      • sequence

        static <E,T> Parser<E,Stream<T>> sequence(Stream<Parser<E,T>> spt)
        Variation of sequence(IList) for Stream.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the error type
        T - the value type of the Parsers in the stream
        Parameters:
        spt - the stream of Parser values
        Returns:
        a Parser which wraps an Stream of values

        Lazy<Boolean> acceptsEmpty()
        Indicate whether this parser accepts the empty symbol.
        Returns:
        a lazy wrapper for true iff the parser accepts the empty symbol

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the parser result

      • map

        default <B> Parser<I,B> map(Functions.F<A,B> f)
        Construct a parser that, if this parser succeeds then returns the result of applying the function f to the result, otherwise return the failure.
        Type Parameters:
        B - the function return type
        Parameters:
        f - the function to be mapped over this parser
        Returns:
        a parser that returns f mapped over this parser's result

      • or

        default <B extends A> Parser<I,A> or(Parser<I,B> rhs)
        Construct a parser which returns the result of either this parser or, if it fails, then the result of the rhs parser.
        Type Parameters:
        B - the rhs parser result type
        Parameters:
        rhs - the second parser to attempt
        Returns:
        a parser which returns the result of either this parser or the rhs parser.

      • and

        default <B> ApplyBuilder._2<I,A,B> and(Parser<I,B> pb)
        Combine this parser with another to form a builder which accumulates the parse results.
        Type Parameters:
        B - the result type of second parser
        Parameters:
        pb - the second parser
        Returns:
        an ApplyBuilder which accumulates the parse results.

      • andL

        default <B> Parser<I,A> andL(Parser<I,B> pb)
        Combine this parser with another to form a parser which applies two parsers, and if they are both successful throws away the result of the right-hand parser, and returns the result of the left-hand parser
        Type Parameters:
        B - the result type of second parser
        Parameters:
        pb - the second parser
        Returns:
        a parser that applies two parsers consecutively and returns the result of the first

      • andR

        default <B> Parser<I,B> andR(Parser<I,B> pb)
        Combine this parser with another to form a parser which applies two parsers, and if they are both successful throws away the result of the left-hand parser and returns the result of the right-hand parser
        Type Parameters:
        B - the result type of second parser
        Parameters:
        pb - the second parser
        Returns:
        a parser that applies two parsers consecutively and returns the result of the second

      • many

        default Parser<I,IList<A>> many()
        A parser which repeatedly applies this parser until it fails, and then returns an IList of the results. If this parser fails on the first attempt then the parser succeeds, with an empty list of results.
        Returns:
        a parser which applies p zero or more times until it fails

      • choice

        static <I,A> Parser<I,A> choice(IList.NonEmpty<Parser<I,A>> ps)
        A parser that attempts one or more parsers in turn and returns the result of the first that succeeds, or else fails.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the parser result type
        Parameters:
        ps - the list of parsers
        Returns:
        a parser that attempts one or more parsers in turn

      • many1

        default Parser<I,IList.NonEmpty<A>> many1()
        A parser which applies this parser one or more times until it fails, and then returns an IList of the results. Note, if this parser fails on the first attempt then the parser fails.
        Returns:
        a parser which applies this parser repeatedly until it fails

      • skipMany

        default Parser<I,Unit> skipMany()
        A parser which applies this parser zero or more times until it fails, and throws away the results. Note, if this parser fails on the first attempt then the parser succeeds.
        Returns:
        a parser which applies this parser repeatedly until it fails

      • sepBy

        default <SEP> Parser<I,IList<A>> sepBy(Parser<I,SEP> sep)
        A parser which applies this parser zero or more times until it fails, alternating with calls to the sep parser. The results of this parser are collected in a IList and returned by the parser.
        Type Parameters:
        SEP - the separator type
        Parameters:
        sep - the separator parser
        Returns:
        a parser which applies this parser zero or more times alternated with sep

      • sepBy1

        default <SEP> Parser<I,IList<A>> sepBy1(Parser<I,SEP> sep)
        A parser which applies this parser one or more times until it fails, alternating with calls to the sep parser. The results of this parser are collected in a IList and returned by the parser.
        Type Parameters:
        SEP - the separator type
        Parameters:
        sep - the separator parser
        Returns:
        a parser which applies this parser one or more times alternated with sep

      • optional

        default Parser<I,Optional<A>> optional()
        A parser that applies this parser, and, if it succeeds, returns the result wrapped in an Optional, otherwise returns an empty Optional.
        Returns:
        an optional parser

      • between

        default <OPEN,CLOSE> Parser<I,A> between(Parser<I,OPEN> open,
                                         Parser<I,CLOSE> close)
        A parser for expressions with enclosing symbols.

        A parser which applies the open parser, then this parser, and then close parser. If all three succeed then the result of this parser is returned.

        Type Parameters:
        OPEN - the open parser result type
        CLOSE - the close parser result type
        Parameters:
        open - the open symbol parser
        close - the close symbol parser
        Returns:
        a parser for expressions with enclosing symbols

      • chainr

        default Parser<I,A> chainr(Parser<I,Functions.Op2<A>> op,
                           A a)
        A parser for an operand, followed by zero or more operands that are separated by operators. The operators are right-associative.
        Parameters:
        op - the parser for the operator
        a - the value to return if there are no operands
        Returns:
        a parser for operator expressions

      • chainr1

        default Parser<I,A> chainr1(Parser<I,Functions.Op2<A>> op)
        A parser for an operand, followed by one or more operands that are separated by operators. The operators are right-associative.
        Parameters:
        op - the parser for the operator
        Returns:
        a parser for operator expressions

      • chainl

        default Parser<I,A> chainl(Parser<I,Functions.Op2<A>> op,
                           A a)
        A parser for an operand, followed by zero or more operands that are separated by operators. The operators are left-associative. This can, for example, be used to eliminate left recursion which typically occurs in expression grammars.
        Parameters:
        op - the parser for the operator
        a - the value to return if there are no operands
        Returns:
        a parser for operator expressions

      • chainl1

        default Parser<I,A> chainl1(Parser<I,Functions.Op2<A>> op)
        A parser for an operand, followed by one or more operands that are separated by operators. The operators are left-associative. This can, for example, be used to eliminate left recursion which typically occurs in expression grammars.
        Parameters:
        op - the parser for the operator
        Returns:
        a parser for operator expressions
